member.summary: A line entity.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DrawingEntity
member.summary: The base class for all entities in the Ivan object model that can be drawn.
member.remarks: All objects that can be drawn and thus have visual attributes associated with them are derived from this class. Things like Lines, Arcs, etc.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DrawingObject
member.summary: The base class for all objects in the Ivan object model that originate in the drawing file.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DrawingObject.ObjectType
member.summary: The type of the object.
member.remarks: The ObjectType classifies the object as belonging to a particular type of object. A line, an arc or an ellipse, for example.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DrawingObject.IsEntity
member.summary: Specifies if the object is a .
member.remarks: If the object is a drawable entity object then this property is true.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DrawingObject.UniqueId
member.summary: The unique identifier for the object.
member.remarks: All objects and entities in the drawing file have a handle to identify them. This value is unique to each object and acts as a "primary key".

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DrawingObject.HasXData
member.summary: Specifies if any extended data exists for the object.
member.value: A bool, true if the has extended data, false if it does not.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DrawingObject.ExtendedData
member.summary: The extended data for the object.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DrawingObject.HasExtensionDictionary
member.summary: Specifies if the object has an extension dictionary attached to it.
member.value: A bool value, true if the object has a dictionary, false if it does not.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DrawingObject.Drawing
member.summary: A reference to the current object.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DrawingObject.ExtensionDictionary
member.summary: The Extension Dictionary attached to the object.
member.remarks: Any object can have a dictionary attached to it. Sometimes third party applications that interface with DWG® files utilize dictionaries as a form of meta data to use at their discretion.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DrawingEntity.Color
member.summary: Color of the entity.
member.value: A object that specifies the color attributes.
member.remarks: Colors can originate from an AutoCAD® Color Index (ACI), a True Color or a Color Book. The TrueColor property exposes a object that can be used to get the ACI value or the RGB values. In addition, if the color originates from a Color Book, it will provide the name of the Color Book as well as the particular entry selected from that book.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DrawingEntity.Layer
member.summary: The layer that the entity is on.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DrawingEntity.Linetype
member.summary: The name of the linetype used to draw the entity.
member.remarks: This property will be ByLayer, ByBlock, CONTINUOUS, or the name of one of the LinetypeList in the collection.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DrawingEntity.Lineweight
member.summary: The lineweight of the entity.
member.remarks: The Lineweight property is used to specify the actual weight of the lines used to draw the entity. Often, whether or not the actual weight is shown when the entity is rendered is a matter of choice.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DrawingEntity.PlotStyle
member.summary: The plot style for the entity.
member.remarks: The plot styles are kept in a dictionary called "ACAD_PLOTSTYLENAME" which is a member of the dictionary.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DrawingEntity.Hyperlink
member.summary: Hyperlink associated with the entity.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DrawingEntity.HasHyperlink
member.summary: Specifies if the entity has any hyperlinks associated with it.
member.value: A boolean value, true if the object has hyperlinks, false if it does not.
member.remarks: If this property is true the property will hold the hyperlink information.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DrawingEntity.LinetypeScale
member.summary: The lineype scale factor for the entity.
member.remarks: Linetypes can consist of dashes and dots. This setting effects the relative lengths of the dashes with respect to the drawing units.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DrawingEntity.HasImage
member.summary: Specifies if the entity has an image attached to it.
member.value: A boolean value, true if the object has image data, false if it does not.
member.remarks: If this property is true then the property will have the bytes of image data. This data is usually for custom proxy entities that use a substitute image to represent them.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DrawingEntity.Image
member.summary: The image data for the entity.
member.value: A byte array to hold the image data.
member.remarks: This data represents the image representation for a custom entity proxy and is in a format that is not outlined here. You will need to check other sources of documentation to understand how to use this data.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DrawingEntity.IsVisible
member.summary: Specifies if the entity is visible or hidden.
member.value: A boolean value, true if the entity is visible, false if it is hidden.
member.remarks: Even if the entity is hidden it is still present in the document and can be referenced.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Line.Angle
member.summary: The angle of the line.
member.value: A double represting the angle of the line.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Line.Delta
member.summary: The delta vector of the line.
member.value: A representing the difference between the and the .

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Line.EndPoint
member.summary: The end point of the line.
member.value: A representing the coordinate of the end point.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Line.Length
member.summary: The length of the line segment.
member.value: A double representing the length of the line segment.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Line.Normal
member.summary: Unit normal vector to the plane the line is on.
member.value: A Point3d whose properties represent the magnitudes of the 3D normal vector.
member.remarks: The normal vector defines the z axis for the line's plane.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Line.StartPoint
member.summary: The start point of the line.
member.value: A representing the coordinate of the start point.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Line.Thickness
member.summary: The thickness of the line.
member.remarks: The thickness it the extrusion of the line in the z direction. This direction is defined by the property.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.JoggedDimension
member.summary: A jogged dimension.
member.remarks: A radial dimension that allows for specifying a more convenient location for the center of an arc or cirlce.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Dimension
member.summary: Base class for all dimension entities.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Dimension.DimStyle
member.summary: The DimStyle object.
member.remarks: This is the object that defines the appearance for the dimension.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Dimension.AnonymousBlock
member.summary: The anonymous block that symbolizes the dimension.
member.remarks: When a dimension is placed in the drawing AutoCAD® automatically, behind the scenes, creates a block to represent it. These "anonymous" blocks are named as *D followed by a numeral. For example, *D1, *D2, etc. These blocks are identified as such by their property being set to true.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Dimension.Normal
member.summary: Unit normal vector to the surface formed by the dimension.
member.value: A Point3d whose properties represent the magnitudes of the 3D normal vector.
member.remarks: The normal vector defines the z axis for the dimension.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Dimension.TextMidpoint
member.summary: The middle point of the dimension text.
member.remarks: This is the horizontal midpoint of the dimension text.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Dimension.Elevation
member.summary: The elevation of the dimension.
member.remarks: The elevation is the z coordinate for the plane of the object.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Dimension.TextOverride
member.summary: Specifies user defined text to override the dimension text.
member.remarks: This text will replace the default text that displays the measurement. A "<>" sequence is used as a placeholder for the primary units. A "[]" sequence is used as a placeholder for the alternate units.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Dimension.TextRotation
member.summary: The rotation of the dimension text.
member.value: A double representing the angle in radians.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Dimension.HorizontalDirection
member.summary: The horizontal direction of the dimension.
member.value: A double representing the angle in radians.
member.remarks: This property is the negative of the angle between the x axis of the object coordinate system (OCS) and the user-defined coordinate system (UCS).

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Dimension.BlockXScaleFactor
member.summary: The block x scale factor.
member.remarks: This is the x scale factor for the anonymous block.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Dimension.BlockYScaleFactor
member.summary: The block y scale factor.
member.remarks: This is the y scale factor for the anonymous block.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Dimension.BlockZScaleFactor
member.summary: The block z scale factor.
member.remarks: This is the z scale factor for the anonymous block.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Dimension.BlockRotation
member.summary: The block rotation.
member.remarks: This is the rotation about the insertion point of the anonymous block.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Dimension.AttachmentPoint
member.summary: Specifies the attachment point of the text.
member.remarks: This property determines where the insertion point coincides with the bounding area of the text.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Dimension.LineSpacingStyle
member.summary: Specifies the line spacing style for the mtext.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Dimension.LineSpacingFactor
member.summary: Specifies the line spacing for the text.
member.remarks: The spacing factor is the distance from the baseline of one line of text to the next line.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Dimension.Measurement
member.summary: The measurement of the dimension.
member.value: A double representing the magnitude of the dimension. For linear dimensions this is a length. For angular dimesions this is an angle.
member.remarks: This is the actual size of the object being measured.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Dimension.BlockInsertionPoint
member.summary: The block position.
member.remarks: This is the insertion point for the anonymous block representing the dimension.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Dimension.HasOverrides
member.summary: Indicates if the dimension has dimstyle property overrides.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Dimension.Overrides
member.summary: A list of the dimension's dimstyle overrides.
member.remarks: If is true, then this list will contain the overrides.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.JoggedDimension.CenterPoint
member.summary: Specifies center of the circle or arc of the dimension.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.JoggedDimension.CurvePoint
member.summary: Specifies point on the circle or arc of the dimension.
member.remarks: This is the first point of the dimension line and lies on the circle or arc.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.JoggedDimension.CenterLocationOverride
member.summary: Specifies an alternate location to specify for the center.
member.remarks: When the center of an arc or circle is located off the layout and cannot be displayed in its true location the origin point of the dimension can be specified at a more convenient location called the center location override.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.JoggedDimension.JogLocation
member.summary: Specifies the jog location.
member.remarks: Specifies the midpoint of the jog line.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Linetype
member.summary: A linetype object.
member.remarks: Linetypes influence how the lines of entities are drawn. The linetype object is an encapsulation of a line style definition. It consists of a name, description and pattern data that controls how the line is rendered. The pattern data consists of dots, dashes and spaces, and in some cases, geometric shapes and text.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Linetype.Name
member.summary: The name of the linetype.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Linetype.Description
member.summary: Specifies the description of the linetype.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Linetype.PatternLength
member.summary: Specifies the pattern length of the linetype.
member.remarks: This value is the sum of all the individual pattern element lengths. A value of zero for this property indicates a solid line.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Linetype.Pattern
member.summary: Specifies the pattern for the linetype.
member.remarks: This is a collection of objects that describe how the line is to be drawn.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Linetype.IsByLayer
member.summary: Specifies whether the linetype is the built-in ByLayer linetype.
member.remarks: Every AutoCAD® drawing has three default, built-in linetypes named ByLayer, ByBlock and Continuous.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Linetype.IsByBlock
member.summary: Specifies whether the linetype is the built-in ByBlock linetype.
member.remarks: Every AutoCAD® drawing has three default, built-in linetypes named ByLayer, ByBlock and Continuous.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Linetype.IsContinuous
member.summary: Specifies whether the linetype is the built-in Continuous linetype.
member.remarks: Every AutoCAD® drawing has three default, built-in linetypes named ByLayer, ByBlock and Continuous.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.ProxyObject
member.summary: Represents a proxy object.
member.remarks:
Third party applications that interface with AutoCAD® must register themselves with AutoCAD®. This class represents a registered application. All registered applications are maintained by the property.
These applications can create objects inside of a drawing. When the application is no longer available on the machine where AutoCAD® is installed, proxy objects are created to represent the third party custom objects.

member.name: M:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.ProxyObject.SetFromPool(System.Byte[],ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.FileVersion)
member.summary: Resets the parsing pointer to the beginning of the DataBits.
member.returns: None.
member.remarks: The DataBits stream pointer remains in the position following the last Get function call made. Therefore, before each subsequent sequence of Get function calls, this method should be called to position the pointer to the beginning of the DataBits data stream. Otherwise, the pointer will move past the legitimate data.
member.exception: The DataBits array is null.

member.summary: The name of the registered class of which this ProxyObject is typed.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.SystemVariables.DIMTAD
member.summary: Specifies the vertical postion of the dimension text relative to the dimension line.
member.value:
An int corresponding to the following:
0 - centers the text between the extension lines
1 - places the dimension text above the dimension line except when the dimension line is not horizontal and text inside the extension lines is forced horizontal, when = 1. The distance from the dimension line to the baseline of the lowest line of text is the value
2 - places the text on the side of the dimension line farthest away from the defining points
3 - places the text to conform to Japanese Industrial Standards

System error occurs with file open.

The format version is not supported.
Parsing and validation failed on the drawing.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Spline
member.summary: A controlled spline.
member.remarks: Splines are curves that are generated based on a mathematical model. Controlled spline geometry is based on a set of control points that determine how the spline will be drawn. Weights are given to the control points that specify the amount of influence or control that the point has on the curve.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Spline.SplineType
member.summary: The type of the Spline.
member.remarks: Splines can be created by specifying fit points or converting other geometry types to a Spline. In the case where the fit points are explicitly specified when designing the Spline the fit points collection will be populated. In the case where Splines were created in another fashion, where the fit points were not explicitly specified by the user, the fit points collection will be empty and the control points collection and knots collection will be populated.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Spline.ControlPoints
member.summary: A collection of the control points.
member.remarks: These are points that are used in the mathematical formula to generate the curve.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Spline.FitPoints
member.summary: The fit points for the spline.
member.remarks: These are the points that define the curve. The property specifies how closely the curve should pass thru these points. A tolerance of zero means that the curve must touch all points.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Spline.IsClosed
member.summary: Specifies if the curve is closed.
member.value: A boolean value, true if the curve is closed, false if it is not.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Spline.IsPeriodic
member.summary: Specifies if the curve is periodic.
member.value: A boolean value, true if the curve is periodic, false if it is not.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Spline.IsRational
member.summary: Specifies if the curve is rational.
member.value: A boolean value, true if the curve is rational, false if it is not.
member.remarks: If this property is true it generally implies that the control points will have weights associated with them.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Spline.KnotTolerance
member.summary: Specifies the knot tolerance.
member.remarks: The tolerance value determines to what degree two consecutive knot values are treated the same. If the difference between their values is less than then KnotTolerance then they are treated the same.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Spline.ControlTolerance
member.summary: Specifies the control point tolerance.
member.remarks: The tolerance value determines to what degree two control points are treated the same. If the distant between the points is less than then ControlTolerance then they are treated as the same point.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Spline.FitTolerance
member.summary: The fit tolerance of the spline.
member.remarks: This value specifies how closely the curve should be to the . The lower the value, the closer the curve is to the points.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Spline.Knots
member.summary: Collection of knots for the spline.
member.remarks: This collection actually holds, in mathematical terms, the breakpoints of the spline. They are used in the formula to generate the curve. They are associated with the intervals that break up the curve into its constituent segments.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Spline.Degree
member.summary: The degree of the spline.
member.remarks: This is the degree of the polynomial equation used to generate the curve.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Spline.StartTangent
member.summary: The start tangent of the spline.
member.remarks: This is the tangent to the curve at the first fit point.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Spline.EndTangent
member.summary: The end tangent of the spline.
member.remarks: This is the tangent to the curve at the last fit point.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Exceptions.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: This is an auxiliary namespace to provide a convenient grouping of all the Ivan exceptions.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Exceptions.IvanException
member.summary: The base class for all Ivan generated exceptions.
member.remarks: All Ivan exceptions are of this type.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Exceptions.UnsupportedDWGVersionException
member.summary: Thrown if the version of the drawing file does not match a version supported by the library.
member.remarks: The file is recognized as a DWG® file but the version is not supported by Ivan.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Exceptions.UnknownFileFormatException
member.summary: This is thrown when an attempt to open a file other than a DWG® R15, R18, R21 or R24 is made.
member.remarks: Currently, the Ivan library supports AutoCAD® versions 2000 thru 2012.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Exceptions.FileNotFoundException
member.summary: Thrown if the drawing file cannot be found.
member.remarks: If the, at the given path and filename, no such file exists, this exception will be thrown.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Exceptions.DrawingAlreadyInitializedException
member.summary: Thrown when the object has already been initialized.
member.remarks: This is thrown by the or method when it is called while a drawing is currently open. Once a drawing is opened it must be closed before Open can be called again.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Exceptions.CannotOpenFileException

members.member:
A single-line text entity.
This object represents a single line of text.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Text.InsertionPoint
member.summary: Specifies the location of the text.
member.remarks: The property setting determines if the InsertionPoint, the or both are used to position the text.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Text.Alignment
member.summary: A combined specification of both the horizontal and vertical alignment of the text.
member.remarks: The text has two alignment properties, and . This property is a single value that is used to represent both settings.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Text.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary: The horizontal alignment of the text.
member.remarks:
Text with this property set to HorizontalAlignment.Left use the property to position the text.
Text with this property set to HorizontalAlignment.Aligned or HorizontalAlignment.Fit use both, the property and the property to position the text.
Text with this property set to any other value use the property to position the text.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Text.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: The vertical alignment of the text.
member.remarks: This property is combined with the property to position the text.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Text.IsBackward
member.summary: Indicates the direction of the text.
member.value: A boolean value, true if the text backward, false if it is forward.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Text.IsUpsideDown
member.summary: Indicates the direction of the text.
member.value: A boolean value, true if the text upside down, false if it is not.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Text.Height
member.summary: The height of the text.
member.value: A double expressing the height of the text in current drawing units.
member.remarks: This property is used as a scale factor for both the height and the width of the text.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Text.Normal
member.summary: Unit normal vector to the surface of the plane of the text.
member.value: A Point3d whose properties represent the magnitudes of the 3D normal vector.
member.remarks: The normal vector defines the z axis for the text.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Text.ObliqueAngle
member.summary: The oblique angle of the text.
member.value: A double value representing the angle in radians.
member.remarks: This angle is the degree to which the text slants to the right or to the left from vertical. Positive values are to the right, negative values are to the left.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Text.Rotation
member.summary: The rotation of the text.
member.value: A double representing the angle in radians.
member.remarks: The angle is relative to the x axis with counter-clockwise representing the positive direction.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Text.ScaleFactor
member.summary: Scale factor for the text.
member.remarks: This value is applied to the width of the text to adjust its horizontal size. Positive values increase its size, negative values decrease its size.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Text.TextString
member.summary: Specifies the actual text of the entity.
member.value: A string object containing the text.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Text.Style
member.summary: The text style object for the text.
member.remarks: This will be one of the text style objects in the collection and specifies the font information used for the text.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Text.Thickness
member.summary: The thickness of the text.
member.remarks: The thickness it the extrusion of the text in the z direction. This direction is defined by the property.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Text.TextAlignmentPoint
member.summary: Specifies where to place the text.
member.remarks: The property setting determines if the , the TextAlignmentPoint or both are used to position the text.

member.summary: Specifies where to place the attribute.

member.summary: A combined specification of both the horizontal and vertical alignment of the attribute.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Attribute.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary: The horizontal alignment of the attribute text.
member.remarks:
Attributes with this property set to HorizontalAlignment.Left use the property to position the text.
Attributes with this property set to HorizontalAlignment.Aligned or HorizontalAlignment.Fit use both, the property and the property to position the text.
Attributes with this property set to any other value use the property to position the text.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Attribute.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: The vertical alignment of the attribute.
member.remarks: This property is combined with the property to position the attribute.

member.summary: Indicates that the attribute has a fixed value.

member.summary: Indicates verification is required upon input.

member.summary: The value for the attribute.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Attribute.Tag
member.summary: The tag for the attribute.
member.remarks: When a block, with an associated , is inserted into a drawing, the user responds to the prompt with a value. This value is placed in the corresonding object. The value is given this Tag property so that it can be retrieved under this name. Attributes allow for the persistence of tag/value pairs.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DimStyle
member.summary: An encapsulation of settings that determine the appearance of a dimension.
member.remarks: Generally, this object type exists to allow the user to define a set of preferences in how the dimensions are rendered. The user may want different styles for different areas of the drawing.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DimStyle.Name
member.summary: The name of the dimstyle.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DimStyle.DIMPOST
member.summary: Specifies the prefix or suffix for the primary dimension text.
member.remarks: A "<>" sequence is used to serve as a placeholder for the measurement text. The prefix or suffix text is placed before or after the "<>", respectively.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DimStyle.DIMAPOST
member.summary: Specifies the prefix or suffix for the alternate dimension text.
member.remarks: A "<>" sequence is used to serve as a placeholder for the measurement text. The prefix or suffix text is placed before or after the "<>", respectively.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DimStyle.DIMSCALE
member.summary: Specifies the scale factor for primary dimensions.

member.value: A double representing the size in drawing units.
member.remarks: This is the size of the dimension line arrowheads, leader line arrowheads, and hook lines.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DimStyle.DIMEXO
member.summary: The extension line offset.
member.value: A double representing the offset in drawing units.
member.remarks: Specifies the distance to offset the extension lines from the origin points for the dimension.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DimStyle.DIMDLI
member.summary: Specifies the dimension line offset for continuation.
member.remarks: Each dimension line is offset from the previous one by this distance.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DimStyle.DIMEXE
member.summary: Specifies the distance the extension line extends beyond the dimension line.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DimStyle.DIMRND
member.summary: Specifies the rounding of primary units.
member.value: A double representing the value to round to.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DimStyle.DIMDLE
member.summary: Specifies the distance the dimension line extends past the extension lines when oblique strokes are drawn instead of arrowheads.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DimStyle.DIMTP
member.summary: Specifies the upper tolerance limit for the dimension text.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DimStyle.DIMTM
member.summary: Specifies the lower tolerance limit for the dimension text.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DimStyle.DIMTOL
member.summary: Specifies if tolerances are diplayed with dimension text.
member.value: An int with 0 for off 1 for on.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DimStyle.DIMLIM
member.summary: Specifies whether dimension limits are displayed.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DimStyle.DIMTIH
member.summary: Specifies the position of the dimension text inside the extension lines.
member.value:
An int value:
0 - false, text is aligned with dimension line
1 - true, text is drawn horizontally

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DimStyle.DIMTOH
member.summary: Specifies the position of the dimension text outside the extension lines.
member.value:
An int value:
0 - false, text is aligned with dimension line
1 - true, text is drawn horizontally

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DimStyle.DIMSE1
member.summary: Specifies if the first extension line is suppressed.
member.value: An int value with 0 for off, 1 for on.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DimStyle.DIMSE2
member.summary: Specifies if the second extension line is suppressed.
member.value: An int value with 0 for off, 1 for on.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DimStyle.DIMTAD
member.summary: Specifies the vertical postion of the dimension text relative to the dimension line.
member.value:
An int corresponding to the following:
0 - centers the text between the extension lines
1 - places the dimension text above the dimension line except when the dimension line is not horizontal and text inside the extension lines is forced horizontal, when = 1. The distance from the dimension line to the baseline of the lowest line of text is the value
2 - places the text on the side of the dimension line farthest away from the defining points
3 - places the text to conform to Japanese Industrial Standards

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DimStyle.DIMZIN
member.summary: Specifies the suppression of zeroes in the display of primary unit values.
member.value:
An int mask with the bit values defined below:
0 - suppress zero feet and suppress zero inches
1 - include zero feet and include zero inches
2 - include zero feet and suppress zero inches
3 - suppress zero feet and include zero inches
4 - suppress leading zeroes
8 - suppress trailing zeroes

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DimStyle.DIMAZIN
member.summary: Controls zero suppression for angular dimensions.
member.value:
An int value:
0 - display all zeroes
1 - suppress leading zeroes
2 - suppress trailing zeroes
3 - suppress all zeroes

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DimStyle.DIMTXT
member.summary: The height of the dimension or tolerance text.
member.value: A double representing the height in drawing units.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DimStyle.DIMCEN
member.summary: Specifies the size of the center mark of the dimension.
member.value:
A double value where:
if = 0 - no center lines or marks are drawn if < 0 - center lines are drawn if > 0 - center marks are drawn

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.DimStyle.DIMTSZ

member.value:
A double value:
0 - draw arrowheads
>0 - draw oblique strokes with size equal to this value times .

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Block
member.summary: A block object.
member.remarks: Blocks are named collections of entities that are used to build symbols. The Block is the symbol definition. When an instance of a Block is inserted into the drawing a is created as the representative for the symbol. There is a one-to-many relationship between a Block and its associated BlockReferences.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Block.Entities
member.summary: The database of entities that comprises the block.
member.value: An object providing access to the block entities.
member.remarks: All objects that make up a block are derived from DrawingEntity.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Block.Name
member.summary: The name of the block.
member.remarks: Each block has a unique name allowing it to be chosen from a pick list.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Block.Description
member.summary: The description of the Block symbol.
member.remarks: The description makes it easy to distingusih one symbol from another in a symbol library.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Block.IsAnonymous
member.summary: Specifies if the block is anonymous.
member.value: A boolean value, true if the block is anonymous, false if it is not.
member.remarks: When a dimension or a hatch is placed in the drawing AutoCAD® automatically, behind the scenes, creates a block to represent it. These "anonymous" blocks are named as *D or *X, respectively, followed by a numeral. For example, *D1, *D2, *X1, etc.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Block.HasNonConstantAttributes
member.summary: Specifies if the block has non-constant attributes.
member.value: A boolean value, true if the block has non-constant attributes, false if it is not.
member.remarks: A constant attribute maintains its value at every insertion.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Block.IsXRefOverlay
member.summary: Specifies if the block is a xref overlay.
member.value: A boolean value, true if the block is a xref overlay, false if it is not.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Block.IsLayout
member.summary: Specifies if the block is a layout.
member.value: A boolean value, true if the block is a layout, false if it is not.
member.remarks: Layouts like ModelSpace and PaperSpace have a block data member to hold all of its entities.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Block.Layout
member.summary: The layout object associated with the block.
member.remarks: If the property is true this property will contain the Layout object associated with the block.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Block.IsXRef
member.summary: Specifies if the block is an external reference.
member.value: A boolean value, true if the block is an external reference, false if it is not.
member.remarks: Complete drawings can be saved as blocks and inserted into other drawings. These types of blocks are called external references. If this property is true then the name of the external file is kept in the property.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Block.XRefDatabase
member.summary: The name of the external reference file.
member.value: A string containing the name of the file.
member.remarks: If the property is true this property will contain the name of the external file.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Block.Origin
member.summary: The origin of the block.
member.remarks: The coordinates of all member objects of the block are relative to its origin. When a block is inserted into the drawing the origin coincides with the insertion point.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.LinetypePatternElement
member.summary: A line pattern element object.
member.remarks: This object represents an individual element in the pattern of a linetype.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.LinetypePatternElement.IsComplex
member.summary: Specifies if the pattern element is of the complex type.
member.value:
A boolean value:
true - is complex
false - is not complex
member.remarks: Linetypes can be made up of complex or simple pattern elements. A simple linetype has only dashes, dots and spaces defining it. A complex linetype has embedded text or shapes included in the definition.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.LinetypePatternElement.IsShape
member.summary: Specifies if the pattern element is of the complex shape type.
member.value:
A boolean value:
true - has embedded shape
false - does not have embedded shape
member.remarks: Linetypes can be made up of complex or simple pattern elements. A simple linetype has only dashes, dots and spaces defining it. A complex linetype has embedded text or shapes included in the definition. This property implies that the pattern element is of the shape type.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.LinetypePatternElement.IsText
member.summary: Specifies if the pattern element is of the complex text type.
member.value:
A boolean value:
true - has embedded text
false - does not have embedded text
member.remarks: Linetypes can be made up of complex or simple pattern elements. A simple linetype has only dashes, dots and spaces defining it. A complex linetype has embedded text or shapes included in the definition. This property implies that the pattern element is of the text type.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.LinetypePatternElement.IsRotationRelative
member.summary: Specifies if the rotation value is relative.
member.value:
A boolean value:
true - rotation is relative
false - rotation is absolute
member.remarks: If the rotation angle is relative it is relative to the tangent of curve of the object that the linetype is attached to.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.LinetypePatternElement.Length
member.summary: Specifies the length of the pattern element.
member.value: A double representing the length in drawing units.
member.remarks: A positive length represents a dash. A negative value represents a space. A zero represents a dot.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.LinetypePatternElement.ShapeIndex
member.summary: Specifies the index of the shape in the shape file.
member.remarks: If the property is true this value represents the position of the embedded shape in the shapefile defined by the FontFile property of the object. If is false then the value is not used.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.LinetypePatternElement.XOffset
member.summary: Specifies the x-offset of the embedded object.
member.value: A double representing the offset in drawing units.
member.remarks:
If is true:
The distance of the lower left corner of the text string from the end point of the line segment measured along the line.
If is true:
The distance of the shape insertion point from the end point of the line segment measured along the line.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.LinetypePatternElement.YOffset
member.summary: Specifies the y-offset of the embedded object.
member.value: A double representing the offset in drawing units.
member.remarks:
If is true:
The distance of the lower left corner of the text string from the end point of the line segment measured perpendicular to the line.
If is true:
The distance of the shape insertion point from the end point of the line segment measured perpendicular the line.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.LinetypePatternElement.Scale
member.summary: Specifies the scale factor for the embedded object.
member.value: A double representing the scale factor.
member.remarks: If the property is true this factor is applied to the style's height.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.LinetypePatternElement.Rotation
member.summary: Specifies the rotation of the embedded object.
member.value: A double representing the rotation angle in radians.
member.remarks: If the property is true then this is a relative value, relative to the tangent of the curve of the object having the linetype, otherwise, the angle is absolute.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.LinetypePatternElement.Text
member.summary: Specifies the text string of the embedded text object.
member.remarks: If the property is true then this property holds the text, otherwise, the property is not used.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.LinetypePatternElement.TextStyle
member.summary: Specifies the TextStyle of the element's text.
member.remarks: If the property is true then this object represents the TextStyle of the element's text. Otherwise its null.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.LinetypePatternElement.Shapefile
member.summary: Specifies the Shapefile of the element's shape.
member.remarks: If the property is true then this object represents the Shapefile of the element's shape. Otherwise its null.

An int whose value corresponds to an AutoCAD® encoding representing the data type.
1000 - a string

1011 - 3D world space position (Point3D)

1013 - 3D world space direction (Point3D)

1071 - long integer (int)

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.HatchCircularArcSegment
member.summary: A circular arc hatch path segment.
member.remarks: This segment of the path is part of a circular arc.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.HatchCircularArcSegment.Center
member.summary: The center of the arc.
member.remarks: This is the point that defines the center of the circle that the arc is on.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.HatchCircularArcSegment.Radius
member.summary: The radius of the arc.
member.value: A double representing the distance from the center to a point on the arc.
member.remarks: The arc is circular so the radius is the radius of the circle containing the arc.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.HatchCircularArcSegment.StartAngle
member.summary: The start angle of the arc.
member.value: A double representing the angle in radians.
member.remarks: A horizontal ray stemming from the to the right would represent an angle of 0 radians. Moving counter-clockwise along the arc, starting at 0 radians and stopping at the start point defines the start angle.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.HatchCircularArcSegment.EndAngle
member.summary: The end angle of the arc.
member.value: A double representing the angle in radians.
member.remarks: A horizontal ray stemming from the to the right would represent an angle of 0 radians. Moving counter-clockwise along the arc, starting at 0 radians and stopping at the end point defines the end angle.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.HatchCircularArcSegment.IsCounterClockwise
member.summary: Specifies if the arc is drawn counter-clockwise.
member.value: A boolean value, true if yes, false if no.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Vertex2d
member.summary: A 2D vertex object.
member.remarks: This is used to represent a point in two dimensional space.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Vertex2d.Point
member.summary: The coordinates of the vertex.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Vertex2d.StartWidth
member.summary: Specifies the width of the segment that starts at this point.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Vertex2d.EndWidth
member.summary: Specifies the width of the segment that ends at this point.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Vertex2d.Bulge
member.summary: Specifies the bulge value for the vertex.
member.remarks: The bulge is the tangent of one fourth the included angle for an arc segment, made negative if the arc goes clockwise from the start point to the endpoint. A bulge of 0 indicates a straight segment, and a bulge of 1 is a semicircle.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Vertex2d.TangentDirection
member.summary: Specifies tangent direction for the vertex.
member.remarks: This is the angle of a line tangent to the curve at the point of the vertex.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Vertex2d.VertexId
member.summary: Specifies the Id of the vertex.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.PolygonMeshVertex
member.summary: A mesh vertex entity.
member.remarks: Collections of mesh vertex entities are used to define the geometry of the entity.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.PolygonMeshVertex.Point
member.summary: Specifies the coordinates of the vertex.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.ControlPoint2d
member.summary: A 2d control point object.
member.remarks: Control points are used by objects to determine their geomtery.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.ControlPoint2d.Point
member.summary: The control point coordinates.
member.remarks: This is the location of the control point in the drawing.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.ControlPoint2d.Weight
member.summary: The weight of the control point.
member.remarks: This value specifies the influence the control point has on the curve.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.AttributeDefinition
member.summary: An attribute definition entity.
member.remarks: Attributes allow for the placement of text or text-based information at predefined locations. Attributes must be contained in a block.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.AttributeDefinition.InsertionPoint
member.summary: Specifies where to place the attribute.
member.remarks: The property setting determines if the InsertionPoint, the or both are used to position the attribute.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.AttributeDefinition.Alignment
member.summary: A combined specification of both the horizontal and vertical alignment of the attribute.
member.remarks: The attribute has two alignment properties, and . This property is a single value that is used to represent both settings.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.AttributeDefinition.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary: The horizontal alignment of the attribute text.
member.remarks:
Attributes with this property set to HorizontalAlignment.Left use the property to position the text.
Attributes with this property set to HorizontalAlignment.Aligned or HorizontalAlignment.Fit use both, the property and the property to position the text.
Attributes with this property set to any other value use the property to position the text.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.AttributeDefinition.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: The vertical alignment of the attribute.
member.remarks: This property is combined with the property to position the attribute.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.AttributeDefinition.IsInvisible
member.summary: Indicates if the attribute should remain invisible when inserted.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.AttributeDefinition.IsConstant
member.summary: Indicates that the attribute has a fixed value.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.AttributeDefinition.IsVerify
member.summary: Indicates verification is required upon input.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.AttributeDefinition.IsPreset
member.summary: Indicates the attribute value is preset, and no input prompt is displayed.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.AttributeDefinition.IsBackward
member.summary: Indicates the direction of the attribute text.
member.value: A boolean value, true if the text backward, false if it is forward.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.AttributeDefinition.IsUpsideDown
member.summary: Indicates the direction of the attribute text.
member.value: A boolean value, true if the text upside down, false if it is not.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.AttributeDefinition.Height
member.summary: The height of the attribute text.
member.value: A double expressing the height of the text in current drawing units.
member.remarks: This property is used as a scale factor for both the height and the width of the text.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.AttributeDefinition.Normal
member.summary: Unit normal vector to the surface of the plane of the attribute.
member.value: A Point3D whose properties represent the magnitudes of the 3D normal vector.
member.remarks: The normal vector defines the z axis for the attribute.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.AttributeDefinition.ObliqueAngle
member.summary: The oblique angle of the attribute.
member.value: A double value representing the angle in radians.
member.remarks: This angle is the degree to which the text slants to the right or to the left from vertical. Positive values are to the right, negative values are to the left.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.AttributeDefinition.Rotation
member.summary: The rotation of the attribute.
member.value: A double representing the angle in radians.
member.remarks: The angle is relative to the x axis with counter-clockwise representing the positive direction.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.AttributeDefinition.ScaleFactor
member.summary: Scale factor for the attribute.
member.remarks: This value is applied to the width of the attribute to adjust its horizontal size. Positive values increase its size, negative values decrease its size.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.AttributeDefinition.DefaultValue
member.summary: The default value for the attribute.
member.remarks: When an is placed in the drawing this value is used if no other value is specified.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.AttributeDefinition.Tag
member.summary: The tag for the attribute.
member.remarks: When a block, with an associated attribute, is inserted into a drawing, the user responds to the prompt with a value. This value is placed in the corresonding object. The value is given this Tag property so that it can be retrieved under this name. Attributes allow for the persistence of tag/value pairs.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.AttributeDefinition.Prompt
member.summary: The prompt for the attribute.
member.remarks: When a block is inserted into a drawing, that has an attribute associated with it, the user is presented with this prompt to query them to enter an appropriate value.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.AttributeDefinition.Style
member.summary: The text style object for the attribute text.
member.remarks: This will be one of the text style objects in the collection and specifies the font information used for the text.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.AttributeDefinition.Thickness
member.summary: The thickness of the attribute.
member.remarks: The thickness it the extrusion of the attribute text in the z direction. This direction is defined by the property.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.AttributeDefinition.TextAlignmentPoint
member.summary: Specifies where to place the attribute.
member.remarks: The property setting determines if the , the TextAlignmentPoint or both are used to position the attribute.

member.name: F:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.BackupMethod.Replace

member.name: F:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.BackupMethod.Append
member.summary: Create a backup of the original file by appending .BAK to the original file name.

member.name: F:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.IntegrityCheckLevel.Deep

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.HatchPath
member.summary: A hatch path object.
member.remarks: Closed paths form the boundries in which hatch patterns are drawn. Paths, themselves, are composed of segments. These segments can be circular arcs, elliptical arcs, lines, polylines, or splines.

member.summary: The collection of boundry objects for the hatch path.
member.remarks: Closed paths form the boundries in which the hatch is drawn. The entities that comprise those paths are the boundry objects. This property is a collection of those objects.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.HatchPath.Segments
member.summary: The collection of objects that comprise the path.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Hatch
member.summary: A hatch entity.
member.remarks: Hatch patterns are elaborate texture definitions that are applied over a defined area. Basically, the hatch is made up of two core components, the boundries that define the area in which the hatch is drawn, and the pattern itself that is actually drawn in those boundries.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Hatch.IsGradient
member.summary: Indicates if the Hatch is filled with a gradient.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Hatch.GradientAngle
member.summary: The rotation angle of the gradient.
member.value: A double representing the rotation angle in radians.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Hatch.GradientShift
member.summary: The shift value of the gradient.
member.value: A double representing the shift value.
member.remarks: This values represents where the gradient wiil emanate from. Usually its either top-left or centered.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Hatch.IsSingleColor
member.summary: Specifies if the gradient is one color or two color.
member.remarks: The gradient can be one color or two color. If this property is true, it is one color.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Hatch.GradientTint
member.summary: The degree of tint or shade for the gradient.
member.value: A double representing the tint/shade value.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Hatch.GradientName
member.summary: The name of the gradient.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Hatch.GradientColors
member.summary: The colors in the gradient.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Hatch.Elevation
member.summary: The elevation of the hatch.
member.remarks: The elevation is the z coordinate for the plane of the object.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Hatch.Normal
member.summary: Unit normal vector to the surface formed by the hatch.
member.value: A Point3d whose properties represent the magnitudes of the 3D normal vector.
member.remarks: The normal vector defines the z axis for the hatch.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Hatch.PatternName
member.summary: The name of the hatch pattern.
member.value: A string containing the name of the pattern.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Hatch.IsSolid
member.summary: Specifies if the hatch pattern is a solid fill.
member.value: A boolean value, true if the hatch is solid, false if it is not.
member.remarks: Hatch patterns can be solid filled or they can be cross-hatched textures.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Hatch.IsAssociative
member.summary: Specifies if the hatch is associative.
member.value: A boolean value, true if the hatch is associative, false if it is not.
member.remarks: Associative hatch patterns update automatically when their borders are modified.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Hatch.PixelSize
member.summary: Specifies the pixel size.
member.remarks: This value is used by various intersection and ray casting operations to determine the density at which to perform it calculations.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Hatch.Paths
member.summary: The collection of objects.
member.remarks: The hatch has a least on closed path, the one that defines its outer most boundries. Other closed paths can exist inside this boundry and the hatch must be layed out about them. This property holds all the closed paths that are in the hatch area.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Hatch.Style
member.summary: The island detection style for the hatch.
member.remarks: When multiple paths are involved, decisions must be made on how the hatch will deal with the islands defined by the additional boundries. They can be ignored or taken in to consideration. This property specifies the method used.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Hatch.PatternType
member.summary: The pattern type for the hatch.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Hatch.DefinitionLines
member.summary: The collection of objects for the hatch.
member.remarks: Hatches are produced by an iterative line drawing process. The appearance of the hatch is controlled by the defintion of these lines. This property is a collection of those line definitions that make up pattern.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Hatch.PatternAngle
member.summary: The angle of the pattern.
member.value: A double representing the angle in radians.
member.remarks: Vertical is zero.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Hatch.PatternScale
member.summary: Specifies the pattern scale of the hatch.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Hatch.PatternSpacing
member.summary: Specifies the pattern spacing for the hatch when is UserDefined.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Hatch.IsDoubleHatched
member.summary: Specifies if the pattern is cross-hatch when is UserDefined.
member.value: A boolean value, true if the pattern is double hatched, false if it is not.

member.remarks: Seed points are used by the drawing algorithm to deal with the case where there are multiple paths. Their usage is governed by the property. They basically indicate what is inside and what is outside the boundries to be interrogated.

member.summary: Specifies the data type of the data item.
member.value:
A int value where:
0-9 String
10-39 Double precision 3D point value
40-59 Double-precision floating-point value
60-79 16-bit integer value
90-99 32-bit integer value
100 String (255-character maximum; less for Unicode strings)
102 String (255-character maximum; less for Unicode strings)
105 String representing hexadecimal (hex) handle value
110-119 Double precision floating-point value
120-129 Double precision floating-point value
130-139 Double precision floating-point value
140-149 Double precision scalar floating-point value
170-179 16-bit integer value
210-239 Double-precision floating-point value
270-279 16-bit integer value
280-289 8-bit integer value
290-299 Boolean flag value
300-309 Arbitrary text string
310-319 String representing hex value of binary chunk
320-329 String representing hex handle value
330-369 String representing hex object IDs

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.XRecordDataItem.Value
member.summary: The actual value of the data item.
member.value: An object castable to the proper data type given by .

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.MLineStyle
member.summary: A mline style object.
member.remarks: The mline style object specifies the properties of the mline as well as the number of elements and the properties of those elements for the mline. An element represents a single line in the mline set.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.MLineStyle.Name
member.summary: The name of the style.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.MLineStyle.Description
member.summary: Specifies the description of the style.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.MLineStyle.StartLineCap
member.summary: Specifies if the start of the mline is capped.
member.value:
A boolean value:
true - the start point is capped
false - the start point is not capped

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.MLineStyle.EndLineCap
member.summary: Specifies if the end of the mline is capped.
member.value:
A boolean value:
true - the end point is capped
false - the end point is not capped

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.MLineStyle.StartOuterArcCap
member.summary: Specifies if the start of the mline has an arc joining its outer lines.
member.value:
A boolean value:
true - the start point has an outer arc
false - the start point does not have an outer arc

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.MLineStyle.EndOuterArcCap
member.summary: Specifies if the end of the mline has an arc joining its outer lines.
member.value:
A boolean value:
true - the end point has an outer arc
false - the end point does not have an outer arc

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.MLineStyle.StartInnerArcCap
member.summary: Specifies if the start of the mline has an arc joining its inner lines.
member.value:
A boolean value:
true - the start point has an inner arc
false - the start point does not have an inner arc

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.MLineStyle.EndInnerArcCap
member.summary: Specifies if the end of the mline has an arc joining its inner lines.
member.value:
A boolean value:
true - the end point has an inner arc
false - the end point does not have an inner arc

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.MLineStyle.Fill
member.summary: Specifies if the mline is filled.
member.value:
A boolean value:
true - the mline is filled
false - the mline is not filled

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.MLineStyle.DisplayMiters
member.summary: Specifies if miters should be drawn at each vertex of the mline.
member.value:
A boolean value:
true - draw miters
false - do not draw miters

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.MLineStyle.StartAngleCap
member.summary: Specifies the angle of the end cap at the start of the mline.
member.value: A double representing the angle in radians.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.MLineStyle.EndAngleCap
member.summary: Specifies the angle of the end cap at the end of the mline.
member.value: A double representing the angle in radians.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.MLineStyle.FillColor
member.summary: Color of the MLine fill.
member.value: A object that specifies the color attributes.
member.remarks: Colors can originate from an AutoCAD® Color Index (ACI), a True Color or a Color Book. The TrueColor property exposes a object that can be used to get the ACI value or the RGB values. In addition, if the color originates from a Color Book, it will provide the name of the Color Book as well as the particular entry selected from that book.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.MLineStyle.Elements
member.summary: A collection of objects that define the individual lines of the mline.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.FaceRecord
member.summary: A polyface mesh face entity.
member.remarks: These faces are joined together to form the polyface mesh. They are defined as a set of indexes into the property of the mesh.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.FaceRecord.VertexIndex1
member.summary: Specifies the first vertex of the mesh.
member.value: A int value representing the index of the vertex in the collection.
member.remarks: The index is base 1. A negative value indicates that the edge that begins at this vertex is invisible.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.FaceRecord.VertexIndex2
member.summary: Specifies the second vertex of the mesh.
member.value: A int value representing the index of the vertex in the collection.
member.remarks: The index is base 1. A negative value indicates that the edge that begins at this vertex is invisible.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.FaceRecord.VertexIndex3
member.summary: Specifies the third vertex of the mesh.
member.value: A int value representing the index of the vertex in the collection.
member.remarks: The index is base 1. A negative value indicates that the edge that begins at this vertex is invisible.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.FaceRecord.VertexIndex4
member.summary: Specifies the fourth vertex of the mesh.
member.value: A int value representing the index of the vertex in the collection.
member.remarks: The index is base 1. If there are only three vertices then this property will be zero. A negative value indicates that the edge that begins at this vertex is invisible.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Point
member.summary: A point entity.
member.remarks: The point entity is a marker that can appear as a dot, circle, square, an x, tick, or plus sign or as a combination of these. The type and size of the point entity is determined by the and , respectively.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Point.Coordinate
member.summary: Specifies the coordinate of the point entity.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Point.Thickness
member.summary: The thickness of the point.
member.remarks: The thickness it the extrusion of the point in the z direction. This direction is defined by the property.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Point.Normal
member.summary: Unit normal vector to the surface formed by the point.
member.value: A Point3d whose properties represent the magnitudes of the 3D normal vector.
member.remarks: The normal vector defines the z axis for the point.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.Point.XAxisAngle
member.summary: Specifies the angle of the x axis of current UCS at the time the point was drawn.
member.value: A double representing the angle in radians.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.LightweightVertex
member.summary: A ligtweightvertex object.
member.remarks: This object is used to represent the vertex of a lightweight polyline.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.LightweightVertex.Point
member.summary: The coordinates of the vertex.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.LightweightVertex.StartWidth
member.summary: Specifies the width of the segment that starts at this point.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.LightweightVertex.EndWidth
member.summary: Specifies the width of the segment that ends at this point.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.LightweightVertex.Bulge
member.summary: Specifies the bulge value for the vertex.
member.remarks: The bulge is the tangent of one fourth the included angle for an arc segment, made negative if the arc goes clockwise from the start point to the endpoint. A bulge of 0 indicates a straight segment, and a bulge of 1 is a semicircle.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.HatchSplineSegment
member.summary: A spline hatch path segment.
member.remarks: This segment of the path is part of a spline.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.HatchSplineSegment.FitPoints
member.summary: The fit points for the spline.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.HatchSplineSegment.StartTangent
member.summary: The start tangent of the spline.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.HatchSplineSegment.EndTangent
member.summary: The end tangent of the spline.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.HatchSplineSegment.Degree
member.summary: The degree of the spline.
member.remarks: This is the degree of the polynomial equation used to generate the curve.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.HatchSplineSegment.IsRational
member.summary: Specifies if the control points are weighted.
member.value: A boolean value, true if the points are weighted, false if not.
member.remarks: Weights determine the degree of influence that the control points have on the curve.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.HatchSplineSegment.IsPeriodic
member.summary: Specifies if the curve is periodic.
member.value: A boolean value, true if the curve is periodic, false if it is not.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.HatchSplineSegment.Knots
member.summary: Collection of knots for the spline.
member.remarks: This collection actually holds, in mathematical terms, the breakpoints of the spline. They are used in the formula to generate the curve. They are associated with the intervals that break up the curve into its constituent segments.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.HatchSplineSegment.ControlPoints
member.summary: A collection of the control points.
member.remarks: These are points that are used in the mathematical formula to generate the curve.

member.name: T:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.HatchDefinitionLine
member.summary: A hatch definition line object.
member.remarks: The pattern for a hatch is defined by a set of definition lines that describe to the hatch generation algorithm how to produce the hatch pattern. The hatch drawing process is an iterative procedure of applying the line definitions and offsetting.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.HatchDefinitionLine.Dashes
member.summary: A collection of double values represent the dash lengths of the definition line.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.HatchDefinitionLine.Angle
member.summary: The angle of the definition line.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.HatchDefinitionLine.OriginPoint
member.summary: The origin point for the definition line.
member.remarks: This is the start point for the first line drawn in the pattern.

member.name: P:ComponentIngenuity.Ivan.HatchDefinitionLine.Offset
member.summary: The offset for the definition line.
member.value: A object representing the offset vector.
member.remarks: This value defines the amount to offset each line that is drawn subsequent to the one before it. It holds the delta-x and delta-y values.
